importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article indicates the most recent update on the impact of Tropical Storm Fengshen in the Philippines, providing context for current weather-related disaster events.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The storm affected the northern and central Philippines over the weekend, with the storm blowing away from Luzon into the South China Sea late Sunday, indicating a time-sensitive disaster situation.

keyTakeAways: A tropical storm named Fengshen, locally known as Ramil, impacted the northern and central Philippines, killing seven people and forcing over 22,000 residents to evacuate due to floods and landslides.
Seven deaths were reported, including one drowning in Roxas City, Capiz, due to high tide flooding and five fatalities in Pitogo, Quezon, when a burned palm tree fell on a sleeping family.
The storm has sustained winds of up to 65 kph (40 mph) with gusts of up to 80 kph (50 mph), and is forecast to move toward Vietnam across the South China Sea.
The Philippines is one of the world’s most disaster-prone countries, regularly facing typhoons, earthquakes, and volcanic activity, with about 20 typhoons annually.

The storm is the 18th tropical cyclone to hit the Philippine archipelago this year, occurring amid ongoing recovery from recent earthquakes that killed over 80 people and damaged over 134,000 homes in central Cebu.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Tropical Storm Fengshen, locally known as Ramil, struck the northern and central Philippines over the weekend, resulting in seven deaths and the evacuation of over 22,000 people due to flooding and landslides. The storm, the 18th cyclone to hit the country this year, originated in Luzon and moved into the South China Sea, with forecasted movement toward Vietnam. Key incidents include a drowning in Roxas City due to high tide flooding and a fatal tree fall in Pitogo, Quezon, where five people, including two children, died while sleeping. The Philippines, already recovering from recent earthquakes, remains highly vulnerable to natural disasters, with about 20 typhoons annually and over 20 active volcanoes, making it one of the world’s most disaster-prone nations.
title: Tropical Storm Fengshen Lashes Northern and Central Philippines, Killing Seven
